column5: Relax, take yer meds , take it like a man, and TIELAX. Today was the day I been chirping about for the past 2 weeks with some members here. First ice fish outing. Totally jacked. Get the gear in gear. All systems ready to go. All was prepared for this day.  All pre reports were favorable for today's outing. I was like a kid waiting for the fat man on Christmas day. Nothing worse then chirping and having to back out because of old age pain, but I had too. I have come to the fact , I am getting old. If you believe that well,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,, Anyways, I spent the day tieing ,  DR.Ketchenany  prescription. A handful of #12,s.
Thems pretty fancy Bro They look like Perch Magnets.
Nice work Brian! Would you happen to know of a split ring pliers that work on very small split rings?
That sucks buddy, ive been laid up with a bad back for quite a while myself. I missed muskie closer and i havent even looked at the ice yet..., soon. hope you feel better!
Shimano have the best split ring pliers. The important thing is they grip ring well holding open  ring.

I have a pair of xuron split ring pliers that work very well on most split rings, but I am trying to open the split rings on size 1 ball bearing swivels, and they are tiny. I have MS too and my hands don't work well, so it may just be me and not the pliers?
Thanks Bye  I just use a small pair of scissors Paul.  Thanks pal. I hope to get out next weekend. Dont push the back thing. It keeps up up right.
Cabelas had the Plano  Stow away water proof cases marked down , crazy price.  Picked a few up. One large for my tying stuff.
I might have to try that Brian, my mini screwdriver slips out too easily.
